availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hartford, Kentucky, businessman. Virginia native. Married Catharine A. Nall. Father of Burgess Nall, William H. Nall, Richard Nall, Alfred Nall, Samuel Nall, Wallace Nall, Mary Bell Nall, and Duff Nall. Merchant in Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eight enslaved people in Ohio County in 1850. Hotel Keeper in Hartford in 1860. President of the Branch of the Peopleâ€™s Bank of Kentucky in Hartford in 1860. Owned ten enslaved people in Hartford in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District No. 1; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District No. 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Town of Hartford, p. 197; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Town of Hartford, p. 12; Find A Grave, "Larkin Nall (1805 - 1888)," Memorial #71468501, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=71468501 (accessed September 21, 2017); KYR-0001-017-0041.
